results.title: Shadow dance
results.brief_description: Impressionistic film, studying the effect of the total eclipse of the sun, in October 1976, in the southern half of Australia, on human and animal behaviour. Scenes of life in Australia are shown prior to, during, and after the eclipse, with a First Nations legend forming the theme of the film. Scenes include First Nations dance, race meetings, fairs, and reactions of the general public in the street. Also includes more orthodox scientific observations.

results.title: Protected
results.brief_description: Dramatised documentary by Alessandro Cavadini looking at the oppression of First Nations peoples by the administrators of the reserve on Palm Island, Queensland, through the locals own improvised re-enactment of their abortive 1957 strike against conditions.

results.title: Australian aborigines: police tracker
results.brief_description:
Episode number 15 of Series “Modern social studies”
A First Nations man’s hunting and tracking skills and how they were learnt. Taken during the University of Sydney’s 1952 expedition to Arnhem Land and produced in collaboration with Professor A.P. Elkin, Professor of Anthropology, University of Sydney.

results.title: Palaeolithic man
results.brief_description: Illustrates the way of life of palaeolithic hunters and food gatherers, based on three sources of evidence that remain today - weapons and implements found near their primitive hearths, drawings from European cave settlements and the nomadic lives of some Australian First Nations peoples.

results.title: Nullabor interlude
results.creator_credit: William M. Carty, Cinesound and Commonwealth Railways
results.brief_description: Two visitors from Britain travel across the Nullarbor Plain from Port Pirie to the “golden city” of Kalgoorlie in a luxurious air conditioned diesel electric train with music, good service and ever-changing colours of the desert. At small settlements along the line, they meet groups of local inhabitants, including First Nations people, and the Flying Doctor. Commentary by Tanya Halesworth.
results.creator_credit_for_label: William M. Carty, Cinesound and Commonwealth Railways

results.title: Mutton birds
results.brief_description:
Episode number 12 of Series “Alcheringa”.
First Nations people gather eggs and hunt the mutton bird on small coastal islands. The birds are removed from their burrows, killed and plucked before being loaded onto bark floats to be carried through the surf back to the campfire.

results.title: Man in the desert
results.creator_credit: Edwin Moses, Keith Gow, David Bairstow and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australian Geography”.
Looks at the human geography of our arid zones by examining the lives of First Nations people, cattlemen and miners - men who live in the waste-land of Australia’s deserts. Almost 90% of arid lands are used by someone at some time for some purpose. Questions why man is attracted to the desert. Explains how man has adapted to this environment and what effect this has had on the environment.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Edwin Moses, Keith Gow, David Bairstow and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
